summary: An email from an OIG Special Agent regarding new information about a phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein on the Friday night before his death. It clarifies that Epstein was never in general population, had a lengthy legal visit that day, and was supervised by BOP staff.

persons.name: I. (OIG)
persons.context: Author of the email, providing information about a phone call made by Jeffrey Epstein and details about his supervision.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who made a 19-minute phone call on Friday night and had a lengthy legal visit that day, supervised by BOP staff.

persons.name: The Warden
persons.context: Briefed OIG Special Agent that Epstein's phone call was 19 minutes long.

persons.name: OIG SPi
persons.context: Was briefed by the Warden about the duration of Epstein's phone call.

connections.description: The Warden briefed OIG SPi about the duration of Epstein's phone call.
I. (OIG) states they did not brief the Warden on information regarding Epstein's call.
BOP staff supervised Epstein during his legal visit on Friday.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit and Phone Call
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a legal visit lasting from approximately 8:00 AM to almost 7:00 PM, supervised by BOP staff. Later that evening, he made a 19-minute phone call at 7:17 PM.

locations: 1 Battery Park Plaza, 29th floor New York, NY 10004
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (implied location of Epstein's incarceration)
keyFacts: A 19-minute phone call was made by Jeffrey Epstein at 7:17 PM on Friday, August 9, 2019.
Epstein was never in general population at the correctional facility, so he did not require an approved call list.
On that same Friday, Epstein had a legal visit that lasted from approximately 8:00 AM to almost 7:00 PM, during which he was supervised by BOP staff.
The communication is an internal email from an OIG Special Agent, dated Sunday, August 11, 2019, discussing new information about events prior to Epstein's death.
